title: SQLBETWEEN Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLBETWEEN Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
BETWEEN
The
BETWEEN
command is used to select values 
within a given range. The values can be numbers, text, or dates.
The
BETWEEN
command is inclusive: begin and end values are included.
The following SQL statement selects all products with a price BETWEEN 10 and 20:
Example
SELECT * FROM Products
WHERE Price BETWEEN 10 AND 20;

To display the products outside the range of the 
Example
SELECT * FROM Products
WHERE Price NOT BETWEEN 10 AND 20;

The following SQL statement selects all products with a ProductName BETWEEN 'Carnarvon 
Tigers' and 'Mozzarella di Giovanni':
Example
SELECT * FROM Products
WHERE ProductName BETWEEN 'Carnarvon Tigers' AND 'Mozzarella 
  di Giovanni'
ORDER BY ProductName;

Reference

❯
★
+1

WHERE Price BETWEEN 10 AND 20;

content_sections.title: Example

content_sections.title: Example

SELECT * FROM Products
WHERE ProductName BETWEEN 'Carnarvon Tigers' AND 'Mozzarella 
  di Giovanni'
ORDER BY ProductName;

practice_exercises.title: Practice Exercise 1
practice_exercises.description: Write code that implements similar functionality.
practice_exercises.solution:

WHERE Price BETWEEN 10 AND 20;

practice_exercises.title: Practice Exercise 2
practice_exercises.description: Write code that implements similar functionality.
practice_exercises.solution:
SELECT * FROM Products
WHERE Price NOT BETWEEN 10 AND 20;

summary: This tutorial covers SQLBETWEEN Keyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLBETWEEN Keyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLBETWEEN Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
